sections.title: The Particles that Build Every Sentence
sections.summary: Particles are small words placed after nouns to show their grammatical role in a sentence.
sections.whyItMatters: Get particles right and you'll be understood even with limited vocabulary. These five particles appear in almost every sentence you'll ever read or hear in Japanese.

sections.title: Getting to Know Each Other
sections.context: Yuki and Kenji chat after class, learning about each other's families.

lines.en: Is your mother a teacher, Kenji?

No, my father is not a teacher. But he is a very kind person.
Is that so? My friend's mother is also kind.
